file.title: Review Arrays
file.bullet:
a list of things
JavaScript arrays are used to store multiple values in a single variable.
Each slot in a JavaScript array can hold any type of data.
In JavaScript, arrays are denoted by square brackets, [ ]. The items in an array are called elements, and are separated by commas.
How do you find out how many items are in an array?
What is the index of the first position of an array?
What happens when we try to access an index in the array that does not exist?
We get a value of undefined.
To iterate means to repeat a process to achieve a desired result.
How de we iterate through an array using an index?
How de we iterate through each element of an array, calling a function?
Why would we use a named function rather that an inline function?
We use named functions because they make it easier to read and understand the code; and, because they make it possible to reuse the code.
